item.description: ![[The Narrow Sea.png]] The smallest of the seas, and most familiar with [[The Three Corners]]’ history of warfare. [[The Narrow Sea]] is the thin border between [[Kapesh]] and [[Gethsemane]].

item.title: The Night Empress
item.description: Zolaen God of Night and The Moons, Major Deity ![[nightempress.png]] Known for their mystery and matronly nature, [[The Night Empress]] is the cryptic mother who sits amongst the [[Zolaen Gods]].

item.title: The North Honor
item.description: A pact formed between the cities of [[The Ward]] during [[The Dragon War]]. Its purpose was to unite the people against their greater foe, the [[Dragons]].

item.title: The North Sea
item.description: ![[The North Sea 1.png]] Ocean waters filled with bounties entombed in ice. [[The North Sea]] is a region touch almost exclusively by the viking sailors of [[The Ward]].

item.title: The Obsidian Temple
item.description: The School of the Gods ![[The Obsidian Temple.png]] Located within the holy city of [[Rockfire]], [[The Obsidian Temple]] is a strange menagerie of many different religious groups all sharing a single roof.

item.title: The Old Tongue
item.description: The Old Tongue evolved from its predecessor, [[The First Tongue]]. Similar to its parent, The Old Tongue is for lack of a better term, a language.

item.title: The Old World of Zol - Excerpts from The Grand Nothing
item.description: A highly controversial text on the archeological discoveries of [[The Grand Nothing]]. Written by Hammond Leduran, Eldon Viconell, and Irid Mathrapp.

item.title: The Oldshards
item.description: [[The Apex]] and [[The Vertex]] ![[the Oldshards.png]] At the start of [[The Awakening]], the [[Changelings]] of [[The Glassius Reach]] found themselves in the possession of two strange relics called [[The Oldshards]].

item.title: The Oodillid
item.description: A long, and slimey creature who is rumored to live beneath [[Kierketholl]]. It is said to be reasonably dangerous, and exceptionally hard to kill.

item.title: The Paige of Cups
item.description: The most powerful of the [[Tarot Ring Bearers]]. [[The Paige of Cups]], or [[Rali Trunsarr]], is the bearer of Paige of Cups ring from [[The Rings of Tarot]], and head of House Cups within the city of [[Zessgorn]].

item.title: The Palace of Drole
item.description: One of Zol’s [[Planes]] of existence Music and laughter can always be heard echoing down its halls. Smelling of incense and cooking foods, [[The Palace of Drole]] is home to [[Yanneran]].

item.title: The Path
item.description: See [[Laelanor]]

item.title: The Pattern
item.description: See [[The Glassius Reach]].

item.title: The Peaks of Myth'ira
item.description: ![[The Peaks of MythIra.png]] The sacred mountains of the [[Dwarves]], filled with fire and precious [[Mythril]]. These imposing peaks are home to cities, riches, and many [[Dragons]].

item.title: The Prime
item.description: See the [[Prime Material Plane]]

item.title: The Provident Oaks
item.description: See [[Gethsemane]] and [[Laelanor]]

item.title: The Pure Forest
item.description: One of Zol’s [[Planes]] of existence Boundless, uncorrupted and wild. [[The Pure Forest]] is an infinite forest that spills off of [[The Lifeweaver]]’s form.

item.title: The Ramshorn
item.description: The protectors of [[The North Honor]]. The valiant and brave souls who fend off the threats of [[The Ward]] and guard the cities of [[Often]] and [[Fike]].

item.title: The Ratking
item.description: Wandering God, Moral of Unrestraint ![[The Ratking.png]] To fall in line is to betray the beauty of chaos and the gifts of an uncertain fate.

item.title: The Raven Queen
item.description: Wandering God, Moral of Wit ![[Raven 2.png]] Sharpness of mind outweighs sharpness of blade. [[The Raven Queen]] carries the moral of Wit.

item.title: The Rebuilding
item.description: An era of [[Zol]] spent in great difficulty. Wilds were tamed, the first cities were built, and the last generation of the old world began to die off.

item.title: The Rings of Tarot
item.description: The Rings of Tarot are a set of magically forged rings created by the [[The Tarot]] people during the founding of [[Zessgorn]].

item.title: The Shroud
item.description: See [[The Shroud of the Void]].

item.title: The Shroud of the Void
item.description: Supreme Void God of Darkness, Major Deity ![[The Shroud of the Void.png]] The Culmination of Darkness, The Consumer, The Great Deceiver, [[The Anti-Trinity]].

item.title: The Space Outside Reality
item.description: An eldritch myth told by alien monsters called [[Illithids]]. Manifesting as one of the [[Planes]] of existence with laws like no other

item.title: The Speakless
item.description: See [[Holyfield]]

item.title: The Storm Horizon
item.description: One of Zol’s [[Planes]] of existence The origin of storms. [[The Storm Horizon]] is an expanse of sea, containing a monolith of solid winds at its center called The Stormheart.

item.title: The Sun
item.description: See [[The Elemental Planes]]

item.title: The Taming of the Badlands
item.description: Western [[Zol]] was originally populated with the most diverse set of beings in [[The Awakening]]. The myriad of people and chaos made for a wild expanse with little to no governing forces.

item.title: The Tarot
item.description: A mystic tradition dating all the way back to [[The Awakening]], originating in the city of [[Zessgorn]]. Its origin is heavily debated amongst historians.

item.title: The Three Corners
item.description: See [[The Three Corners of Civilization]].

item.title: The Three Corners of Civilization
item.description: ![[Zol World Map v1.png]] A land bound by dangerous and impassible wilds, [[The Three Corners of Civilization]] sits on the edge of [[The Grand Nothing]].

item.title: The Trinity
item.description: “We all move through the trinity” ![[Pasted image 20230918203704.png]] One and the same with [[Zol]]. A force of three parts, manifested from the residual power of [[Goh’zul]].

item.title: The Triumvirate
item.description: The assumed progenitor races of Zol: [[Dwarves]], [[Elves]], and [[Humans]]. Many theories exist about the origins of these races and their place in the world.

item.title: The Undari
item.description: See [[Penthe]] and [[Ryze]]

item.title: The Underdark
item.description: ![[The Underdark.png]] The vast nexus of caves the spans underneath [[Zol]]. No one knows the width and depth to which these caves reach, but it is thought that less than 1% of it has been mapped.

item.title: The Undoing
item.description: The most influential event in all of [[Zol]]’s history. [[The Undoing]] is the name for the event which destroyed all of [[Old Zol]] and created [[The Grand Nothing]].

item.title: The University
item.description: Those who seek to understand [[The Wills]], the people of [[The Three Corners]], and how the world can be bettered. [[The University]] was founded upon altruistic motives during the later stages of [[The Taming of the Badlands]].

item.title: The Unknown Realm
item.description: One of Zol’s [[Planes]] of existence A plane brought to [[Zol]] by the [[The Wandering Gods]]. A vast forest containing many unique estates, each homed by one of the [[The Wandering Gods]].

item.title: The Vast Sea
item.description: ![[The Vast Sea.png]] An endless, daunting horizon of sea. [[The Vast Sea]] is the furthest west named region of [[Zol]]. Thought by many to be endless, this sea gives life to those who reside on the coasts of the west, and some who spend their whole lives upon it on the strange [[Keepships]].

item.title: The Vertex
item.description: See [[The Oldshards]]

item.title: The Void
item.description: What remains of the [[Sea of Monsters]], one of Zol’s [[Planes]] of existence The horror of [[Zol]]. Home to the evil [[Void Gods]].

item.title: The Wandering Gods
item.description: A group of powerful cosmic beings, alien to [[Zol]]. The wandering gods are heavily associated with [[The Undoing]]. Some believe they caused the event with the intention of taking [[Zol]] from the [[Zolaen Gods]], others believe that they came to protect [[Zol]] from future Undoing, as guardians who battle whatever truly caused it.

item.title: The Ward
item.description: ![[The Ward.jpg]] Cut off from the rest of the world, [[The Ward]] is a wild, untamed land where the only constants are the howling winds and the roiling seas.

item.title: The Wasp Eater
item.description: Void God of Plague, Minor Deity ![[The Wasp Eater.png]] He who culls, King of Plagues, [[The Wasp Eater]] is a hyper intelligent being who claims to seek the fair destruction of life itself.

item.title: The Watcher
item.description: See [[The Watcher in The Door]].

item.title: The Watcher in The Door
item.description: Supreme Zolaen God of Light, Major Deity ![[The Watcher.png]] “Come light, come darkness and sky. Come stillness, come ocean and storm.

item.title: The Wills
item.description: [[The Wills]] are the three known possible manifestations of [[Magic]] sourced from [[The Trinity]]. [[Observance]], [[Magic]] connected to gods or some other source of power itself other than nature [[Viridescence]], [[Magic]] connected to the power of [[Zol]]’s natural world [[Arcana]], [[Magic]] pulled from the unbound power that exists all throughout [[Zol]].

item.title: The Witchlands
item.description: ![[The Witchlands.jpg]] The unconquerable woods, populated by strange animals and monsters. Home to beastfolk, bandit, witch and wizard that seek a lifestyle unoffered by the societies of kingdoms.

item.title: The Word of Blades
item.description: Faraday, The Edge of [[The Edinokai]], Bearer of The Word of Blades, Wielder of [[The First Tongue]] ![[Faraday.png]] The greatest swordsman of [[The Three Corners]].

item.title: The Word of Fire
item.description: Valmore, Hero of Three Fires, Bearer of The Word of Fire, Wielder of [[The First Tongue]] ![[Valmore.png]] The Guardian of [[Kapesh]], and patriarch of the [[Church of Three Fires]].

item.title: The Word of Growth
item.description: Isil, Guardian of Gethsemane, Bearer of The Word of Growth, Wielder of [[The First Tongue]]* ![[Isil.png]] A druid of unmatched power.

item.title: The Word of Shadow
item.description: The Word of Shadow, Unseen Hero, Wielder of [[The First Tongue]] ![[Shadow.png]] The Word of shadow is the anonymous [[Wordbearer]]. No one knows their true identity, origin, or place of residence.

item.title: The Word of Wrath
item.description: Jaw, Horror of Galfora, Bearer of The Word of Wrath, Wielder of [[The First Tongue]] ![[Jaw.png]] Living destruction, the killer of men.

item.title: The Wrath Wastes
item.description: Once a lush and strange forest called Galfora. Technically part of [[Gethsemane]], [[The Wrath Wastes]] are now an dangerous and barren wasteland of sharp jagged stone and grey sand.

item.title: The Wretch
item.description: Said to be the last remnant of [[Goh’zul]]. A once all powerful eater of worlds, reduced to a pathetic wisp of a being who barely clings on to life.

item.title: Tieflings
item.description: Demon Blooded ![[Tiefling.png]] Description Much stigma and legend revolves around [[Tieflings]]. Said to be of demonic nature, [[Tieflings]] are both feared and adored for their unique manifestation.

item.title: Trains
item.description: see [[The Iron Tracks]].

item.title: Transmutation
item.description: [[Transmutation]] is one of the [[Schools of Magic]]. It is magic that specializes in the conversion of [[Space, Matter, and Energy]].

item.title: Trinaism
item.description: Body, Soul, and Vizir. From these three things, we are one. ![[Trinian.png]] Overview [[Trinaism]] is a Trinity-Centric denomination of religion within [[The Three Corners of Civilization]].

item.title: Triton
item.description: See [[Tritons]]

item.title: Tritons
item.description: Those of Lake, River, and Sea ![[Triton.png]] Description [[Triton]] come in many shapes and sizes. Some appear very fish-like, while others appear more like humans or elves covered in scales.

item.title: Triumvirate
item.description: See [[The Triumvirate]]

item.title: Triumvirate Battles
item.description: [[The Triumvirate]] nations, [[Kapesh]] and [[Gethsemane]], have a historic reputation for sparring with one another. Separated by [[The Narrow Sea]], these nations warred from roughly annum 2600 to 4000.

item.title: True Form
item.description: see [[The Glassius Reach]]

item.title: Uroga, Hag of the Sea
item.description: Void God of Fathoms, Major Deity ![[uroga.png]] Queen of the deep, the most powerful of the mysterious [[Hags]]. she who commands the horrors that lurk in the depths of the ocean.

item.title: Viridescence
item.description: [[Viridescence]] is the second of [[The Wills]]. It is [[Magic]] that was used to build the physical world of [[Zol]]. It requires a deep understanding of ones place as a living being in the world, and the connections between all things.

item.title: Viridium
item.description: [[The University]]’s institution of nature and its power. The [[Viridium]] studies the will of [[Viridescence]] from an academic perspective. Not only does it seek to understand the wonder and majesty of nature.

item.title: Viscera
item.description: The city that never sleeps ![[Viscera Skyline 3.png]] Located on the border of the dangerous and magical Witchlands, tucked into the foothills of [[Demodemacht]], and built on the shore of The Purelakes.

item.title: Vizir
item.description: Vizir is a fragment of [[The Trinity]] held within all beings in [[Zol]]. When harnessed, it allows one to access [[The Wills]] in a minor way, granting [[Magic]] power.

item.title: Void Gods
item.description: Fear the depths of Zol, for not even the Gods know what true horrors lurk in its Void The Dark [[Gods]] who lurk deep, deep beneath [[Zol]] in [[The Void]].

item.title: Wanderian
item.description: All who wander ![[Wanderian.png]] Overview [[Wanderian]] belief is the religious denomination of Wanderer-Centric belief. It is a relatively uncommon, and unstructured belief system.

item.title: Warfare
item.description: War within [[Zol]] is a delicate thing. In a place where the scale of physical and magical power is vastly different on either end, warfare can become far too dangerous if not kept in check.

item.title: Warforged
item.description: Of Iron and Light ![[Warforged.png]] Description Spawned from [[Mechanicum Immaculatum]] during the early 4th millennium. Some say [[Warforged]] were discovered, while others say they were created.

item.title: Wayward Gods
item.description: [[Gods]] that are not aligned with [[The Watcher in The Door]], [[The Wandering Gods]], or the [[Void Gods]]. They may be benevolent, wrathful, or have their own personal goals.

item.title: Weaving - A Spectacle
item.description: This weaving occurs right after [[Godkiller Chapter Summary - 11 - The Masquerade Murder]] Magnus disappeared from view as the carriage rounded a corner.

item.title: Weaving - A Tale of Three Stones
item.description: He was the first of three stones. Despite his age, he did not have a name. But most stones lacked this trait, so it never struck him as odd.

item.title: Weaving - Adjunct
item.description: Merle loved working at the Adjunct. Most scribes found it busy, tedious, and involving far too many face-to-face interactions with the public.

item.title: Weaving - Ahamatath
item.description: Stolen from the restricted Bladehammer Guild Archives by Cyrus on the 19th of Spring, Annum 4466. Official Communication from the desk of Guild Master Helg Corsair - five years and two seasons ago.

item.title: Weaving - Arch Nemesis
item.description: Grimbel has had many arch-nemeses in his life, but Howdy was by far the most devious. His last nemesis, Rozwald, had left him Howdy.

item.title: Weaving - Creatures in Cages
item.description: Lora patted his forehead dry once more. His dehydration was worsening, so there wasn’t much to wipe away. Was he going to die?

item.title: Weaving - Desperate People
item.description: Cliff’s wizened eyes panned over the day’s batch of first-timers. Early spring always brought a surge of them. The downtrodden. Driven out of their illegitimate upper-city nooks by the garrison.

item.title: Weaving - Elsewhere in the City
item.description: This weaving is a series of scenes that all occur simultaneously with the start of [[Godkiller Chapter Summary - 17 - Fight Dirty]]

item.title: Weaving - End Times
item.description: “I saw it with me own eyes! There he was, standin’ atop Belzan Tower. All dark and silhouette-like with the sun behind him.

item.title: Weaving - Fear
item.description: Our story began a long, long time ago. Pieces of it wash up on the shore of history like the remains of a shipwreck.

item.title: Weaving - Fight Like Bandits
item.description: Cursing his luck, Hobb spun, dodging the axe a third time. He had only been back for a day since his journey with Magnus and he was already fighting again.

item.title: Weaving - Godian Bestiary - Goblins
item.description: The Common Goblin, Goblina Commonus ![[GoblinDiagram.png]] [[Goblins]] are one of the many entries within this Bestiary that exist between the realms of monsters and men.

item.title: Weaving - Lectures on Ferrication - 1
item.description: Next part: [[Weaving - Lectures on Ferrication - 2]] The common man often associates apparatum with terms such as arcane, useful, or mysterious.

item.title: Weaving - Lectures on Ferrication - 2
item.description: Previous part: [[Weaving - Lectures on Ferrication - 1]] Take everything you know about objects, and throw it out the window.

item.title: Weaving - Mortuum Priums - 1
item.description: The Dead Progenitor Expedition - Lead Researcher Jacklyn Spearhead’s Log - Day 146 The Mortuum Primus is indescribable. Unfortunately, describing it is the very task I’ve set out to do.

item.title: Weaving - Mortuum Priums - 2
item.description: The Dead Progenitor Expedition - Lead Researcher Jacklyn Spearhead’s Log - Day 150 - 1/2 One of my instruments finally registered The Mortuum Primus today.

item.title: Weaving - Mortuum Priums - 3
item.description: The Dead Progenitor Expedition - Lead Researcher Jacklyn Spearhead’s Log - Day 150 - 2/2 The different accounts, rumors, and retellings of how Lord Gallahue conned The Eethryli and gained us The Alliance Tome probably outnumbers the tome’s very own page count.

item.title: Weaving - OId Friend
item.description: Six years ago A gentle, icy breeze skated across the frozen, endless landscape. Visible only as powdered veils of blown snow and the tousling of dark, shoulder-length curls.

item.title: Weaving - Scriptures of Nothing - 1
item.description: We were their chosen. Our lives immortal given purpose by their divine plan. We paved their streets with gold and raised walls of glowing stone.

item.title: Weaving - Scriptures of Nothing - 2
item.description: We had purpose, but it in no way belonged to us. Our path was flanked by low walls. Physically, we could stray, but unbeknownst to us we would be returned time and time again until we decided correctly.

item.title: Weaving - Slaughter with Extra Steps
item.description: Haith watched the flickering light of his fireplace reflect off the cool metal before him. The heat was a meager thing, but he liked how it mixed with the open balcony’s cool spring air.

item.title: Weaving - That and A Lot More
item.description: Rubic landed hard on his back, skidding slightly across the wet floor of the cell. Its metal door was slammed in his face as he forced himself to his feet, not staying down for more than a second.

item.title: Weaving - The Antisequence - 1
item.description: The bullet rips through your jaw, tearing flesh and shattering teeth. It feels fitting, this. You can’t recall the last time your head was above water.

item.title: Weaving - The Antisequence - 2
item.description: The sequence comes to you more frequently these days in large, more coherent pieces rather than the usual flashes. Returning memories of death still haunt you, despite them never actually occurring.

item.title: Weaving - The Antisequence - 3
item.description: You recall your training coming to an abrupt end, like a meal confiscated before the final bites. Unsatisfying. Dairo sets you to work like a chisel to stone— hard and violent labor.

item.title: Weaving - The Antisequence - 4
item.description: Your fateful exchange with Tserlbane returns as one of your most complete ‘memories’. “Mallory,” The mage’s icy voice crawled through the bowles of Brass Taldora.

item.title: Weaving - The Hour of Shadows
item.description: Silk sat still, crouched against the pale stones of the windswept grove. Everything always looked wrong to her during The Hour of Shadows.

item.title: Weaving - The Middle of Seven
item.description: Bennet’s back twinged as he sat up from his single bed. Would his suffering never end? He’d endured the humiliation of being caught uninvited at the Beast’s Ball, then he’d been forced to spend half a day suffering fools and scraping shit off of Gilligan’s Lift, and now he’d be sore for the entire First Ring.

item.title: Weaving - The Warforged Dream
item.description: The introduction to the first chapter of the campaign. A dream shared amongst each of the members of the party witnessed during their last slumber before meeting each other.

item.title: Weaving - The Wrath Wastes
item.description: The elves called it Galfora. The changelings, Mak’si’dahn. A place where the majesty of Yan Nalora met the twisted beauty that pours from the Lifewell.

item.title: Western War
item.description: See [[Yorn et Gaul]]

item.title: Witches
item.description: Those who practice a [[Magic]] through various uses of [[The Wills]]. They do not subscribe to the normal ins and outs of society, nor the structure of academia.

item.title: Wood Elves
item.description: See [[Elves]]

item.title: Woogis
item.description: The Quiet Coast ![[Woogis Skyline.png]] A small city that feels a world away from the challenges and strife that most of [[Zol]] faces.

item.title: Wordbearer
item.description: See [[Wordbearers]]

item.title: Wordbearers
item.description: See [[The First Tongue]]

item.title: Wrath Wastes
item.description: See [[The Wrath Wastes]]

item.title: Xerul
item.description: The City of the High Elves ![[Xerul 3.png]] The elegant city of [[Xerul]] rests in the center of [[Gethsemane]]. Populated by the proud High Elves, the city is ancient, and resplendent.

item.title: Yanneran
item.description: Zolaen God of Art and Wine, Major Deity ![[Yanneran.png]] Known for their jovial and free spirited nature, [[Yanneran]] is the most liberal of the [[Zolaen Gods]].

item.title: Yoel Sundarum
item.description: The Secluded Iceberg City ![[Yoel Sundarum 2.png]] It is not known how long [[Yoel Sundarum]] has been around for, and many outsiders think it to be a myth.

item.title: Yorn et Gaul
item.description: The scarred city of Changelings ![[Yorn Et Gaul Skyline.png]] [[Yorn et Gaul]] was once the greatest city within [[The Glassius Reach]].

item.title: Zelatt
item.description: see [[Zelatt, The Draconic Amalgam]].

item.title: Zelatt, The Draconic Amalgam
item.description: Void God of Chaos, Major Deity ![[Zelatt.png]] A hauntingly beautiful force of chaos. Zelatt is the mother of all [[Chromatic Dragons]].

item.title: Zephyrean
item.description: I, of the Storm ![[Zephyrean.png]] Overview [[Zephyrean]] belief is often defined by some as an [[Obscuran]] religion. While true by some definitions, [[Zephyrean]] belief is one of the larges religious denominations that is not a Zolaen-Centric, or Trinity-Centric belief system.

item.title: Zessgorn
item.description: Costal beauty ![[zessgorn 3.png]] Zessgorn, the City of Cups. Located in [[The Free Cities of Alderun]], and once known as the Tarot City.

item.title: Zessgorn Cups
item.description: Zessgorn Cups are a social tool utilized in the city of [[Zessgorn]] to determine someone’s status and house membership in the cities complex socioeconomic structure.

item.title: Zezan Bard College
item.description: A wild and eclectic school of The Arts, and even a little [[Magic]]. [[Zezan Bard College]], located in [[Kahdinacht]] is a place of study regarding each of the facets of art:

item.title: Zol
item.description: Welcome to the world of [[Zol]], by Jacob AE Turner ![[updated banner 2k with text.png]] Explore Zol [[Introduction]] - A synopsis of the world Regions - The geographical locations within the world [[Cities]] - An index of all cities located within the world [[Gods]] - The powers that move beyond the veil of reality [[Historical Timeline]] - The world’s history [[Planes]] - The interconnected worlds within worlds [[Races]] - The sapient beings of the world [[Magic]] - The mechanics of the force that drives everything [[Miscellaneous Topics]] - Useful information about the world For more information about the creation of Zol, and rules about its usage, please read the [[Disclaimer]]

item.title: Zol's Perspective of the Universe
item.description: Zol is not well versed in the complexities of [[The Cosmos]]. Some individuals posses insights into the stars that others lack, but the majority of academic knowledge about The Universe is limited to a few things:

item.title: Zolaen Gods
item.description: The pantheon of [[Gods]] that created [[Zol]] from the [[Sea of Monsters]]. The [[Zolaen Gods]] are a pantheon of gods who closely follow the [[The Watcher in The Door]].

item.title: Zolaen Scripture
item.description: The comprised writings regarding the [[Zolaen Gods]], compiled by theologians and priests since [[The Awakening]].

item.title: Zolaeum Notica
item.description: Zolaeum Notica is the Human translation of ‘Notes on Zol’ A Text written by Aldaemus Mysc on the subject of [[Zol]]’s history, gods, magic and planes.
